TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AssociationAttribute extends System.Data.Linq.Mapping.DataAttribute

Docs.summary: Designates a property to represent a database association, such as a foreign key relationship.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this attribute to represent an association in a database, such as the relationship between a foreign key and a primary key.
In the following example, the `Order` class includes an AssociationAttribute attribute to associate Orders with Customers.
## Examples [!code-cs[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/associationattribute/northwind.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/assnattribute/northwind.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
When placed on a 1:1 association whose foreign key members are all non-nullable, deletes the object when the association is set to null.
Docs.value: Setting to deletes the object. The default value is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets delete behavior for an association.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If set to null, no delete behavior is added. For example, "CASCADE" would add "ON DELETE CASCADE" to the foreign-key relationship.
In the following example, the rule is to take no action.
## Examples [!code-cs[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/associationattribute/northwind.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/assnattribute/northwind.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the member as the foreign key in an association representing a database relationship.
Gets or sets the indication of a uniqueness constraint on the foreign key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When true, this property indicates a true 1:1 relationship.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets one or more members of the target entity class as key values on the other side of the association.
Docs.value: Default = Id of the related class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For multiple members, use a comma-separated list.
The key is not required to match the primary key or foreign key, but the user-stated cardinality (0-1 for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntityRef%601> or 0-n for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntitySet%601>) is assumed to be true.
## Examples [!code-cs[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/associationattribute/northwind.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/assnattribute/northwind.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets members of this entity class to represent the key values on this side of the association.
Docs.value: Default = Id of the containing class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For multiple members, use a comma-separated list.
The key is not required to match the primary key or foreign key, but the user-stated cardinality (0-1 for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntityRef%601> or 0-n for <xref:System.Data.Linq.EntitySet%601>) is assumed to be true.
## Examples [!code-cs[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/associationattribute/northwind.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AssociationAttribute#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/assnattribute/northwind.vb#3)]
